posts.content:
Hi! I just wanted some help building a SS properly. 

First, some SS info. I intend to play PVP, but I can't seem to get a decent AB.
  • Wizard Hit Die upgraded to d8
  • Wizard AB progression upgraded to 3/4
  • They gain Simple and Martial Weapon proficiency
  • They gain Light and Medium Armor proficiency
  • They gain Uncanny Dodge
  • They gain 5% Arcane Spell Failure reduction to Armor
  • They gain +15 Discipline at level 28
  • If they aren't holding anything in their offhand (shield, bow, two-hander, etc), they gain +1 (Shield) AC per int modifier, capped by wizard level/6+1 to a maximum of 6 at 30
    • Monks using a single Kama are denied this bonus for balance purposes
  • Gains the ability to Imbue. Upgrade to Greater Imbue at level 21. (Imbue is infusing temporary properties to your weapon.)
  • The epic spell, Epic Mage Armor behaves differently in the hands of a spellsword. Instead of granting the usual +5 to all four armor types (Armor, Natural, Deflection, and Dodge), it grants only +4, totaling in a +16 to AC - however, it also grants a bonus to +4 AB while it is active. Note that EMA does not stack with the regular Mage Armor in any way.
Spellswords gain the ability to use Medium armor. 

Drow starting abilities: 2 Dex, 2 Int, 2 Cha, -2 Con. Can take a gift to remove the +2 Cha and give +2 Con after character is made.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I don't play on Arelith so some of what I write below might be wrong.

Your level progression is slightly wrong, you write 22-24 as Specialist but based on your feats those are actually Spellsword levels.

According to the wiki, the AB bonus (including the BAB increase) is soft and counts towards the +20 cap. [http://wiki.arelith.com/Spellsword]
With +12 STR and at the AB cap, your AB is limited to 15 (BAB) + 12 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 20 (AB Bonus) = +51
Currently you get +5 AB from the BAB increase, +5 AB from GMW (unless +6 weapons are available), and +4 AB from EMA, so you're 6 AB from the cap.

Below is your current AC with +1 INT, chainmail, and +3 AC boots. The max AC version uses full plate armor, a +3 tower shield, and +3 AC boots.
Current AC: 10 (Base) + 2 (DEX) + 6 (Tumble) + 2 (Feats) + 5 (Armor) + 3 (AC Bonus) + 5 (Shield Bonus) + 5 (Shield) + 5 (Shadow Shield) + 8 (EMA) + 4 (Haste) = 55
Max AC: 10 (Base) + 1 (DEX) + 6 (Tumble) + 2 (Feats) + 8 (Armor) + 3 (Shield) + 6 (AC Bonus) + 5 (Shield) + 5 (Shadow Shield) + 8 (EMA) + 4 (Haste) = 58

Currently you're at +45AB/55AC, but you can potentially reach +51AB/57AC. It is possible to get 6 AB from divine spells but when cast from wands or scrolls their duration is pretty low. You can improve your AC to 57 by getting +12 DEX and wearing padded armor. It might be possible to improve that even further, but that's the best I can do with the items and spell changes that I'm aware of.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Although I have played Arelith for several years, I have never played a Spellsword.

First, I would recommend checking out the Arelith build-dump and more importantly the build mechanics channel on either/both the unofficial (established but a little salty) Arelith Discord or the official (new) Arelith Discord. You will get far better advice there than here. There is vast knowledge here, but Arelith is so customised both in across the class mechanics and the world mechanics making it difficult for builders to understand and plan for the nuances. Most of the “Arelith” builds recommended here perform poorly on the server as a result. They are however, pretty solid build for a less customised server :)

Specialist is a rather new addition but you can replace the bard portion of the following build with specialist if you wish. This is a recommended spellsword build from the unofficial Arelith Discord and was built prior to the changes that added specialist and heavily customised Discipline making it a little less “required”. If you do go specialist, you will need to use your free feat to add a skill focus to meet the requirement for specialist. As a Drow, you will lose a pre-epic feat, I suggest Greater Abjuration and then spend your “Specialist” feat on either Lore or Discipline and drop Greater Abjuration into your epic feats.
